result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy D Frey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Fine of $1,000.00 including court costs, all applicable surcharges, assessments and DNA surcharge. Payable by cash bail on deposit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy D Frey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Jeremy D Frey in court with attorney Stefanie Jean Novack.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense withdraws motion.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 22 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 22 days time served.  

-Court ordered defendant pay a fine in the amount of $1,000.00 INCLUDING Court costs, all applicable surcharges, assessments and DNA surcharge payable by cash bail on deposit.  Any remaining balance to be returned to person who posted

Defense requests a Motion to Suppress.  Court vacates currently scheduled jury trial.  Matter calendared for a motion hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy D Frey in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jeremy D Frey in custody.  Ronald Dague for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Lesley Piotrowski-Greenfield Police Department Officer.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
